item.title: Cracking a paid script
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

lesterknome:

Nice tutorial, learned quite a lot from it. Do you think you could possibly find a way to do this with a nexus script or is that too well protected?

i havent looked at any nexus scripts. i would believe that u can crack all java programs that handle authentication, and if the authenication is server-side, which it should be, it depends on how well they programmed their server-side authentication. but i mean if u have the data then u can just write something to use the data and u will have no need for a cracked script.

T4_:

Is cb.F(String) the encryption method within the loader?

yes that method is the script makers own encryption method. it encrypts and decrypts so i used it to encrypt new txt.

Read full topic

item.title: Cracking a paid script
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

edit: i believe the script has been updated and the info in this tutorial may be invalid. u can try for urself but i havent had time(school) or reason(havent been botting in a while) to try to crack this script. also my teacher suspended our classes hosting account until we make our site look more professional.

I seen a challenge so I took it. It wasn’t a hard challenge but I learned some stuff from it. super_ from the forum said I should post how I did it so here I will. The tutorial I’m going to attempt to write will be cracking a paid RSbot script. This doesn’t apply to everyone of them. This only applies to the ones that use this method to conceal their compiled code. I believe that the ppl who made the script deserve to have their script paid for. This should only be used for educational purposes. If you need pictures I’ll try to take them, but I’m going to write this without the need of them. I’m not an expert in no means, and this is probably my first tutorial so ya. sorry for the horrible layout i dont have the time to work on it, i dont even really have the time to make this tut but i am, so i hope i can get it finished in one sitting.

Credits:
The script devs: kiko, and shadowmoose
The creators of bcel, eclipse, and any other application I use here
and to anyone whom’s work i use

What you need:
bcel: http://jakarta.apache.org/site/downloads/downloads_bcel.cgi
a java decompiler (I used multiple different ones. JODE, JD, etc)
jclasslib bytecode viewer (can help)
an account for the paid script (i didnt buy the script i just know someone that did and used their info)
an IDE like eclipse helps

Step 1 - obtaining the jar:
With the iDungeon script, they give you a launcher. This launcher follows a protection method that is explained here(http://www.powerbot.org/vb/showthread.php?t=527049) with a custom en/decoding method. The launcher I used can be obtained here(http://shadowscripting.wordpress.com/download-idungeon/).

So open up ur decompiler. open the launcher jar in that program. look in the main class.

find the line where the URLClassLoader is declared (for this script it is in the loop method). below isnt what u will see but it will be close(for idungeon unless other script writers use the same encoding method).

notice the i.l method you will need to include that method, to en/decode the strings in the project u create in ur IDE or folder of sources.

id advise u look at the tutorial that it looks like they used from the powerbot forums b/c if the scripter uses what they suggest and u mess up whoever bought the account will no longer have one… good thing for me this scripter didnt do that, bad for them since now i have their code they tried to keep guarded. the iDungeon site checks to see where the request is coming from, if its not java then it redirects u somewhere. this is what i got from decoding using the method mentioned: “shadowmoose.com/iDungeon/New_Loader/createJar.php?name=user&pass=pass”(not exactly the same but i added stuff to try to speed this up).

so what u have to do is create a java program to download the jar. I found a snippet online(http://www.javabeat.net/tips/36-file-upload-and-download-using-java.html) and used it. this is what i ended up with its a mess sorry but it works. u have to hard code the urls in but for this u only need to use it once:

[code]package misc;
import java.io.BufferedInputStream;
import java.io.BufferedOutputStream;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileOutputStream;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.net.MalformedURLException;
import java.net.URL;

import sun.net.www.URLConnection;

public class dsfv {

/**
 * @param args
 * @throws IOException 
 * @throws MalformedURLException 
 */
public static void main(String[] args) throws MalformedURLException, IOException {
	// TODO Auto-generated method stub
	download("./idungpro.jar");
}

public static void download(String string ) throws MalformedURLException,
         IOException
   {
         BufferedInputStream bis = null;
         BufferedOutputStream bos = null;
         try
         {
            URL url = new URL( "http://www.shadowmoose.com/iDungeon/New_Loader/createJar.php?name=/*user*/&pass=/*pass*/" );
            java.net.URLConnection urlc = url.openConnection();

            bis = new BufferedInputStream( urlc.getInputStream() );
            bos = new BufferedOutputStream( new FileOutputStream(
                  string ) );

            int i;
            while ((i = bis.read()) != -1)
            {
               bos.write( i );
            }
         }
         finally
         {
            if (bis != null)
               try
               {
                  bis.close();
               }
               catch (IOException ioe)
               {
                  ioe.printStackTrace();
               }
            if (bos != null)
               try
               {
                  bos.close();
               }
               catch (IOException ioe)
               {
                  ioe.printStackTrace();
               }
         }

}

}
[/code]

I used that to obtain the jar.

Step 2 - editing the jar
Now that u have the jar time to have it direct to ur webhost or what not. you can use multiple methods but this seemed the easiest. u should be able to use the same project in ur IDE. include the bcel, idungeonpro, and launcher as libraries. you will want to find the files u want to edit, and extract them from the jar. read over the bcel tut here(http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=216985.0). this is what i ended up using(just c&p from that tut). it would be easier if u included the strings as parameters for the modify method but i am probably only going to use this multiple times this one time:

[code]import java.io.IOException;

import com.sun.org.apache.bcel.internal.classfile.ClassFormatException;
import com.sun.org.apache.bcel.internal.classfile.ClassParser;
import com.sun.org.apache.bcel.internal.classfile.Method;
import com.sun.org.apache.bcel.internal.generic.ClassGen;
import com.sun.org.apache.bcel.internal.generic.ConstantPoolGen;
import com.sun.org.apache.bcel.internal.generic.InstructionHandle;
import com.sun.org.apache.bcel.internal.generic.InstructionList;
import com.sun.org.apache.bcel.internal.generic.LDC;
import com.sun.org.apache.bcel.internal.generic.MethodGen;

public class Converter
{
private ClassGen cGen;

    public Converter()
    {
            loadClass();
            modify();
            dumpClass();
    }
    
    private void loadClass()
    {                
            try {
                    cGen = new ClassGen(new ClassParser("/*loadclass*/s.class").parse());
            } catch (ClassFormatException e) {
                    e.printStackTrace();
            } catch (IOException e) {
                    e.printStackTrace();
            }
    }
    
    private void modify()
    {
            Method build = null;
            
            for(Method m : cGen.getMethods())
            {
                    if(m.getName().equals("/*methodname*/run"))
                    {
                            build = m;
                            System.out.println("run found!");
                            break;
                    }
            }
            
            ConstantPoolGen cPoolGen = cGen.getConstantPool();
            MethodGen methGen = new MethodGen(build, cGen.getClassName(), cPoolGen);
            InstructionList iList = methGen.getInstructionList();
            
            InstructionHandle titleLDC = null;
            
            InstructionHandle[] iHandles = iList.getInstructionHandles();
            
            for(int f = 0; f < iHandles.length; f++) 
            {
                    if((iHandles[f].getInstruction() instanceof LDC) && ((LDC)iHandles[f].getInstruction()).getValue(cPoolGen).equals("/*string to find*/JWUR\034\f\nU]T\007QFBIMEN^MEF\033AUN\026KzVSEgLo\rJLdFoQ&KJVcEwL\f|B'"))
                    {
                            LDC tempLDC = (LDC)iHandles[f].getInstruction();
                            if(tempLDC.getValue(cPoolGen).equals(/*string to find*/"JWUR\034\f\nU]T\007QFBIMEN^MEF\033AUN\026KzVSEgLo\rJLdFoQ&KJVcEwL\f|B'"))
                            {
                                    titleLDC = iHandles[f];
                                    System.out.println("found LDC");
                                    break;
                            }
                    }
            }
            
            LDC ldcIns = new LDC(cPoolGen.addString(cb.F(/*replacement string*/"http://krishenry.us/iDungeon/New_Loader/createJar.php")));
            
            titleLDC.setInstruction(ldcIns);
            
            iList.setPositions();
            methGen.setInstructionList(iList);
            methGen.setMaxStack();
            methGen.setMaxLocals();
            methGen.removeLineNumbers();
            
            cGen.replaceMethod(build, methGen.getMethod());
    }

	public void dumpClass()
    {
            try 
            {
                    cGen.getJavaClass().dump("/*saveclass*/s.class");
            }
            catch(IOException ex) 
            {
                    ex.printStackTrace();
            }
    }
    
    public static void main(String[] args)
    {
            new Converter();
    }

}[/code]

the pro jar i found the strings i needed to edit in the s class.

step 3 - the web
ok after u get through the stuff above u still need a website with php enabled to make this work(actually u dont u can do with this however as long as it gets the data it wants). i just followed the structure they used and copied it to my site. go to the urls u find in the s class visit them. and mimic their output. this is what i use:
highscores.php

[code]

iDungeon Rankings

table
{
border-collapse:collapse;
}

td.ex
{
background-color:#00B82E;
text-align:center;
}

td.ex:hover
{
background-color:#5CFF85;
text-align:center;
}

table,td,th
{
border:1px solid gray;
}

td
{
background-color:#00DB37;
color:white;
text-align:center;
}

td:hover
{
background-color:#5CFF85;
color:white;
text-align:center;
}

a {text-decoration:none; color:black;}
a.ex{text-decoration:none; color:blue;}

(Click a user's name to view their details)
<table border = "1" bgColor="gray" ID="main"> 
 <tr> 
 <th> Rank </th> 
 <th> Name </th> 
 <th> Experience Gained </th> 
 </tr>

#>218#><?php echo $_GET['name']; ?>[/code]

usersonline.php

[code]<?php

echo “3”;

?>[/code]

createjar.php

[code]<?php

header(‘Location: iDungeonpro.jar’);

?>[/code]

checkuser.php

[code]<?php

echo “true”;

?>[/code]

That concludes my crappy rushed tutorial. its not much of a tutorial, but most of the information u need is here. i left out a few things may be some ppl will be able to help out others if they are having trouble. i may look at this time to time and try to fix things but i just wrote this in a hurry. the purpose was to show a way to conceal ur code and at the same time see how someone can still get it. and inspire someone to think up a way to block this method i showed here. Im tired so i expect a lot of missing and possible messed up stuff especially since im not going to proofread it.

Read full topic
